newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai rice futures end mixed in slow trading.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai rice futures end mixed in slow trading.

text.p: Shanghai rice futures ended mixed in slow trade on Friday, with many investors sidelined, traders said.
The key September 1996 contract ended at 2,527 yuan ($304) per tonne, up 19 yuan. It opened at 2,519, hitting an intra-day low of 2,502 and a high of 2,530.
October fell 16 to 2,509 yuan per tonne.
Traders said institutional buying supported the September contract above the key 2,500-yuan level, while most retail investors stayed out on a lack of market-moving news.
"Many investors did not want to trade before the weekend." one trader said.
Traders expect rice to consolidate at low levels in the next few days.
